gnu.cajo.utils
Class BaseItem

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--gnu.cajo.utils.BaseItem
public class BaseItem
extends java.lang.Object

A standard base class for server items. Server items differ from proxy items in that they never leave their host VM.

Version:
1.0, 01-Nov-99 Initial release
Author:
John Catherino

Nested Class Summary

          The main processing thread of this Item.

Field Detail

mob

protected java.rmi.MarshalledObject mob
A reference to the proxy served by this item. It is assigned by the ItemServer during its bind operation. It is the item's proxy, if it has one, otherwise a remote reference to itself, encased in a MarshalledObject

runnable

protected BaseItem.MainThread runnable
A reference to the item's processing code. If non-null, it will be started automatically binding in the rmiregistry. Its thread can be accessed through the thread member.

thread

public java.lang.Thread thread
A reference to the item's processing thread. It can be interrupted, to signal the item to perform an orderly shutdown.

Constructor Detail

BaseItem

public BaseItem()
The constructor does nothing, server item configuration is be done by application specific subclasses.

Method Detail

getProxy

public java.rmi.MarshalledObject getProxy()
This method is called by the remote clients, to request the item's proxy, if it supports one. If it does not, it will return null.

Returns:
A the proxy serving this item, encased in a MarshalledObject, if the item has a proxy interface, otherwise null.

setProxy

public Remote setProxy(Invoke proxy)
                throws java.lang.Exception
This method is called by remote clients to install their proxies in this VM. This invocation will only succeed if acceptProxies was true when it, or any of this application's items, were bound. The received proxy's init method will be invoked with a reference to itself, remoted in the context of this VM. This is to initialize the proxy, and provide it with a handle to pass to other remote items, on which they can contact this item. This remote reference will also be returned to the caller, providing an interface on which to asynchronously call its proxy.

Parameters:
proxy - The proxy to run in this VM.
Returns:
A reference to the proxy remoted within this context.
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - If the item does not accept proxies.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the item provided is a remote reference.
java.lang.Exception - If the proxy rejected the initialization invocation.

setProxy

public void setProxy(java.rmi.MarshalledObject mob)
This method is called by the ItemServer during a bind operation, if the item has a proxy interface.

Parameters:
mob - The item's proxy object, if it supports one, otherwise a remote referenced to itself, either way, encased in a MarshalledObject

startThread

public void startThread()
This method is called by the ItemServer during a bind operation. If the item has a processing thread, meaning its runnable member is not null, the thread will be started, and its reference stored in the thread member.
